content: It's time for date reference triage. I plan on starting this. Anyone else want to join? I'd just like to make sure we don't duplicate work.
when are you planning to do so?
Just working on it right now, while following #t-compiler/meetings . I'd be happy to do the easy ones. We can then discuss the ones that are not obvious (at least to me).
@Santiago Pastorino do you have an impression of how true this still is: "The structure of the repository is going through a lot of transitions. " I have the feeling this has settled.
but in particular I'd avoid this kind of phrases in general
like it seems to me that, that's something that could always happen
if somebody creates an MCP and it's accepted the structure could be completely changed
but when that happens we should just fix the guide
and not excusing that the structure may be outdated or something
Perhaps a good rule of thumb is if something is _likely_ to change in the next 6 months add a date identifier. If it's not particularly likely to change, don't add one
